pr_title: [bluetooth] Read device information during discovery process

timeline.message:
[bluetooth] Read device information during discovery process

Signed-off-by: Pauli Anttila <pauli.anttila@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Please don't use abbreviations for these.
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Why was the timeout increased to 2 seconds? It should never take longer than a split second to communicate to a connected device. My use of 1 second was already excessive.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: There could be many request on the queue, so even 2 seconds might not be enough. Anyhow, I changed it back to 1 second.
replies.author: paulianttila

replies.bodyText: How many requests at once are you trying to take into account? I think that 10 requests at once would be the max to reasonably expect.
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Don't know, but example one airthings device service discovery take around 5 seconds (47 characteristics). I increased that time from 1 sec to 5 and it seems work rather well, but still some times I saw timeout (service discovery fails). Not sure what happens if there would be more than one airthings devices.
replies.author: paulianttila

replies.bodyText: I think that the double service discovery calls might be causing the timeout issues. I'm ok with you increasing the service discovery timeout to whatever value works for you. But the characteristic read/write timeouts should remain low.
replies.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText:
I don't see the benefit of putting this in a list if you have to do a switch statement on each of them anyway.
I think a better way would be to have a helper function that takes a characteristic as parameter instead and you conditionally call the helper function based on the presence or absence of the device field of interest.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: I wouldn't use lambdas here so that you can properly throw checked exceptions
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: I think you can implement this without using Optional. Would be simpler to just use a GattCharacteristic instead of a UUID.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Not sure if it's simpler, but not agains it either. I have understood that Optional should be used rather than nullable variables.
replies.author: paulianttila

replies.bodyText: I don't think there is anything wrong with nullable variables per se, just that it can become a pain to constantly do null checks when it would be reasonably expected to be non-null at the time.
replies.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Could you also add these fields to BluetoothDeviceSnapshot? Please? 😄
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Didn't notice that you have introduced new snapshot device. What's the idea behind it?
replies.author: paulianttila

replies.bodyText:
It is basically there to keep track of data that was available to discovery participants at the time of discovery. So if new data became available the discovery service would know to rerun the discovery process since discovery participants which were previously unable to discover anything may now be able to discover something.
But on second thought you can skip adding the fields to BluetoothDeviceSnapshot since that should be reserved for data coming from advertising packets.
replies.author: cpmeister

timeline.author: cpmeister
